title: US greenhouse gas emissions rise before Trump policies even kick in
subhed: CO₂ emissions from the world's second-largest polluter have started rising again due to a cold winter and the use of coal to power data centers. The consequences of Donald Trump's attacks on climate action are expected to soon make the situation even worse.

title: French PM to force budget through Parliament without a vote
Iran warns protesters who joined 'riots' to surrender
Trump isolated after trade escalation with Europe over Greenland
subhed: The president's threats could undermine the agreement reached by the United States and the European Union in the summer of 2025.

title: On Réunion Island, thousands flock to witness the eruption of the Piton de la Fournaise volcano
subhed: The eruption's favorable location, its intensity and the timing during the austral summer school holidays led to a steady stream of thousands of people onto the volcano's massif throughout the night.

title: Valentino Garavani, fashion designer who founded Valentino, dies at 93
subhed: Renowned for the elegance of his designs, Garavani made vibrant red his signature color. The dress he created for Jackie Kennedy for her wedding to Aristotle Onassis brought him international fame. He died on January 19 at the age of 93.

title: Jean Pisani-Ferry, economist: 'Is AI fueling a new wave of growth or a bubble?'
subhed: When two Nobel laureates disagree over the potential impact of artificial intelligence, it signals that the massive investments now underway carry risk, notes economist Jean Pisani-Ferry. Through its own savings, Europe is also exposed to those risks.

France 'does not intend' to accept to join Trump's 'Board of Peace,' Macron's aide says
Trump tells Norway he has no obligation to 'think purely of peace' after Nobel snub
Europe signals readiness to hit back after Trump's tariff threat

From Trump to Nvidia, Davos prepares for American might
Portugal presidential election: Socialist Antonio José Seguro leads in first round
The strange airborne rescue of Gaza's donkeys, from Israel to Europe
subhed: Since 2022, Sharon Cohen, who runs an animal rescue group near Tel Aviv, has removed donkeys from Palestinian owners she accuses of mistreatment and sent them to shelters across Europe. The initiative has drawn outrage amid Gaza's deepening humanitarian crisis.

title: Minneapolis emerges as new epicenter of resistance to Trump: 'ICE wasn't expecting that'
subhed: For several weeks, Minnesota's largest metropolitan area has been living under the strain of Operation Metro Surge, which saw the deployment of 2,000 Immigration and Customs Enforcement officers. Since the death of Renee Good on January 7, tensions with residents have reached a peak.

title: 'Why War?': How thinkers answer this heartbreaking question
subhed: Since the bloodbath of World War I, philosophers have repeatedly grappled with the question: Is war an irrepressible human urge, or the product of historical and social forces?

title: The necessary showdown with Donald Trump
'In the face of Trump's imperialism, realism means defending the law as an indispensable tool'
